boardgame.name: Augsburg 1520
boardgame.description: From Alea:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game is about Jakob Fugger, who was probably the wealthiest man of his time. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;Jakob the Rich,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; as he was named in his time, owned so much money that he loaned money to a host of counts and kings. Often, they were not able to repay him in cash, so they awarded him special privileges, such as trade rights and offices._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 to 5 players ages 12 and up assume the role of the merchants from Augsburg and try to get what they can -- by means of auctions -- from the nobility, thus increasing their wealth and particularly their social status._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game play uses a simple bidding mechanism. Each round, players offer cards of varying values in a series of five auctions. Once a bid is made, players either raise the bid, call, or drop. The winning player may choose from a set of possible actions that increase abilities (and more importantly, points). After a number of rounds (dependent on the number of players), scores are tallied. It's that simple._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This is a game by Karsten Hartwig, whose other game _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;Chinatown_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; was already published by Alea. Game length varies -- depending on the number of players -- between 25 to 90 minutes. The difficulty level is a 4 on the Alea 1-10 scale (the same as Ra)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Besides the players_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo; tableaus and a game board, there are 90 game cards and various game chits._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This game is #3 in the Alea medium box series._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: never played +++++ manual is in german, but you can surely download rules translations from boardgamegeek or alea´s website soon. the game components are almost completely language independent anyway +++++ will be shipped insured +++++ payment for germany : personal pick up in berlin or bank transfer +++++ payment for usa, canada, asia and australia : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have no euro : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have euro : direct bank transfer (wich is cost-free !) or cash (by letter) +++++ for all : no checks ! +++++ international buyers beware : though german postal is relatively fast, they sadly are not cheap (about 19 - 45 euros, it depends on where the parcel has to be shipped and it´s weight), so please ask for prices, before you hit the buy button ! +++++ shipment inside germany costs 8 euros

never played +++++ german version, but game components are almost completely language independent and you can download english translations from boardgamegeek +++++ will be shipped insured ++++++++++ international payment : paypal OR direct bank to bank transfer (wich is cost-free inside european union by the way) OR cash (in a registered letter, exchanged into euros already) +++++ payment for germany : paypal OR personal pick up in berlin OR direct bank to bank transfer +++++ for all : no checks ! ++++++++++ international buyers beware : though german postal is relatively fast, they sadly aren´t cheap. it costs bewteen 19 - 37 euros for parcels up to a weight of 5 kg (= about 4 big boxed boardgames). price depends on where the package has to be shipped, so please ask for prices, before you hit the buy button ! +++++ insured shipment inside germany costs 8 euros

I ship everything via USPS Priority Mail flat rate boxes - with _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Fragile,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Keep Dry,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Do Not Bend_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; written on the boxes. The rate structure for those boxes is as follows: Shipping for games that will fit within a 8.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 5.25_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 1.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; box costs $4.95. Shipping for games that will fit within a 13.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 11.75_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 3.25_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; box costs $10.70. I can easily combine shipping if games will fit within these boxes. If they don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t, I can still combine shipping, but that is a little tricker. Thursdays are the days I get most of my shipping done, if that helps you.

All our games are brand new, some might have their shrink removed to show it to our customers. Combined shipping may be available on multiple purchases, this will save you money. Shipping arrangements are available upon request but may vary in cost. Spellekijn is a brick _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; mortar shop located in Leeuwarden, The Netherlands – we are not someone_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s garage or basement. We offer free open gaming and events to the public at the store and have over 3400 titles in stock (we do not list them all on BGG). You can find them all on our website. You are also free to contact us. International Customers, please ask for your precise shipping costs. Methods of payment: • You can always pick the game up in our local shop :-) • You can make a bank transfer free of charge to an EU bank account using IBAN/BIC if your bank account is nominated in EURO. • You can use paypal Euro paypal. (That should be the first choice for non-EU customers) Check our website: www.spellekijn.nl prices may be different on our website due to special BGG offers. Just leave a note and you will receive the lowest price.

Selling one copy of the Rio Grande Games 2006 edition of Augsburg. English-language components and rules are included. Game is unplayed. Original game insert is still intact and in excellent shape. The box appears to be in pretty good condition. There are the beginning signs of flaring around the long box top edges. Game comes from non-smoking house.
